tests.name: Empty table free
tests.description: Test that freeing an empty table causes no errors

tests.name: Table add
tests.description: Test adding 5 buckets with unique IPs to the table

tests.name: Table add collision
tests.description: Test adding 100 buckets with unique IPs to the table, ensuring collision

tests.name: Table print
tests.description: Test that printing the table works properly, and is in the correct format

tests.name: Table add and get
tests.description: Test adding buckets and retrieving them with table_get

tests.name: Table add and get collision
tests.description: Test adding buckets and retrieving them with table_get, adding enough buckets for hash table collisions

tests.name: Table to file
tests.description: Test that writing a table to a file works

tests.name: Table from file
tests.description: Test that you can write and read a table to a file, with both tables containing the same values

tests.name: Mapreduce with not enough args
tests.description: Test the mapreduce program to make sure that it checks the number of args properly

tests.name: Mapreduce with invalid args
tests.description: Test the mapreduce program to make sure that it checks the number of args properly

tests.name: Mapreduce with invalid directory
tests.description: Test the mapreduce program with with an invalid directory argument

tests.name: Number of mapper files
tests.description: The mapreduce program creates the correct number of intermediate files (one file / mapper)

tests.name: Map fail with not enough args
tests.description: The map program prints the requested error if it is called with not enough arguments

tests.name: Map fail with invalid input file
tests.description: The map program fails with an invalid input file. It must print the error message specified in the writeup

tests.name: Map write to requested file
tests.description: The map program writes to the requested file. It should be the second parameter input to the executable

tests.name: Map single file
tests.description: The map program correctly maps data from one log file into a table.

tests.name: Map multiple files
tests.description: The map program correctly maps data from multiple log file into a table.

tests.name: Number of reducer files
tests.description: The mapreduce program creates the correct number of intermediate files (one file / reducer)

tests.name: Reduce with not enough args
tests.description: The reduce program prints the requested error if it is called with not enough arguments

tests.name: Reduce fail with invalid input directory
tests.description: The reduce program fails with an invalid input directory. It must print the error message specified in the writeup

tests.name: Reduce fail with invalid IP arguments
tests.description: The reduce program fails with an invalid IP range (not numbers). It must print the error message specified in the writeup

tests.name: Reduce with all IPs
tests.description: The reduce program is able to accept and operate on all IP addresses

tests.name: Reduce with shortened IP arguments
tests.description: The reduce program is able to accept a range of first IP address bytes and only examine those IPs

tests.name: Reduce with multiple input files
tests.description: The reduce program is able to operate on data across multiple input files

tests.name: Reduce write to requested file
tests.description: The reduce program writes to the requested file. It should be the second parameter input to the executable

tests.name: All log files (1/1 mapper/reducer)
tests.description: Test that using mapreduce on all of the log files produces the expected output. One mapper and one reducer will be used for this

tests.name: All log files (10/1 mapper/reducer)
tests.description: Test that using mapreduce on all of the logs produces the expected output. 10 mappers and one reducer will be used

tests.name: All log files (1/10 mapper/reducer)
tests.description: Test that using mapreduce on all of the logs produces the expected output. one mapper and 10 reducers will be used

tests.name: All log files (10/3 mapper/reducer)
tests.description: Test that using mapreduce on all of the logs produces the expected output. 10 mappers and 3 reducers will be used

tests.name: All log files (10/10 mapper/reducer)
tests.description: Test that using mapreduce on all of the logs produces the expected output. 10 mappers and 10 reducers will be used

tests.name: All log files (24/255 mapper/reducer)
tests.description: Test that using mapreduce on all of the logs produces the expected output. 24 mappers and 255 reducers will be used
